adjectives.description: roughcast (comparative more roughcast, superlative most roughcast)

examples: The whole piece  […] seems  […] a loose model and roughcast of what I design to do.

entries.meaning: A rough surface finish, as of a plaster or stucco wall.
A mixture of pebbles or similar material used to finish a plaster or concrete wall.

verbs.description: roughcast (third-person singular simple present roughcasts, present participle roughcasting, simple past and past participle roughcast or roughcasted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To shape crudely; to form in its first rudiments, without correction or polish.
examples: Nor bodily, nor ghostly negro could / Rough-ccast thy figure in a sadder mould.

entries.meaning: To apply a roughcast finish to.
examples: to roughcast a wall or building
